member.name: M:LakeShoreCryotronics.FastHall.FastHall.Close
member.summary: Closes the I/O session to the instrument, as well as other unmanaged resources. The behavior is the same as IDisposable.Dispose.

member.name: M:LakeShoreCryotronics.FastHall.FastHall.GetService(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets the service object of the specified type. Typically, this is an interface supported by the driver.
member.param: The type object of the service to get. Typically, this is the type of an interface supported by the driver.
member.returns: A service object of the specified type. Null is returned if there is no service object of the specified type.

member.name: M:LakeShoreCryotronics.FastHall.FastHall.Dispose
member.summary: Performs driver-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources. Calling this method is equivalent to calling the driver's Close method.

member.name: M:LakeShoreCryotronics.FastHall.FastHall.ResetInterchangeCheck
member.summary: Resets the interchangeability checking algorithms of the driver so that methods and properties that executed prior to calling this method have no affect on whether future calls to the driver generate interchangeability warnings.

member.name: M:LakeShoreCryotronics.FastHall.FastHall.InvalidateAllAttributes
member.summary: Invalidates all of the driver's cached values.

member.name: M:LakeShoreCryotronics.FastHall.FastHall.GetSupportedInstrumentModels
member.summary: Returns the list of instrument models that the IVI specific driver can control. The string does not include an abbreviation for the manufacturer if it is the same for all models.

member.name: M:LakeShoreCryotronics.FastHall.FastHall.GetGroupCapabilities
member.summary: Returns the list of the class capability groups implemented by the driver. Capability group names are documented in the IVI class specifications. If the driver is not class compliant, the driver returns an empty array.

member.name: M:LakeShoreCryotronics.FastHall.FastHall.ErrorQuery
member.summary: Queries the instrument and returns instrument specific error information.
member.returns: A struct that includes the instrument error code and error message.

member.name: M:LakeShoreCryotronics.FastHall.FastHall.SelfTest
member.summary: Performs an instrument self test, waits for the instrument to complete the test, and queries the instrument for the results. If the instrument passes the test, TestResult is zero and TestMessage is 'Self test passed'.
member.returns: A struct that includes the numeric result from the self test operation (0 = no error, e.g. the test passed) and self test status message.

member.name: M:LakeShoreCryotronics.FastHall.FastHall.Disable
member.summary: Quickly places the instrument in a state where it has no, or minimal, effect on the external system to which it is connected. This state is not necessarily a known state.

member.name: M:LakeShoreCryotronics.FastHall.FastHall.ResetWithDefaults
member.summary: Does the equivalent of Reset and then, (1) disables class extension capability groups, (2) sets properties to initial values defined by class specs, and (3) configures the driver to option string settings used in the driver constructor.

member.name: M:LakeShoreCryotronics.FastHall.FastHall.Reset
member.summary: Places the instrument in a known state and configures instrument options on which the IVI specific driver depends (for example, enabling/disabling headers). For an IEEE 488.2 instrument, Reset sends the command string *RST to the instrument.

member.name: M:LakeShoreCryotronics.FastHall.FastHall.Lock
member.summary: Attempts to acquire a synchronization lock on this instance of the driver. The calling thread is blocked indefinitely until the lock is acquired. This method is useful for gaining exclusive access to the driver instance across a series of methods calls. The user must call the Unlock method on the returned lock to relinquish the lock and allow other threads to access this instance of the driver.
member.returns: A reference to the acquired lock. Unlock is called on the returned reference.

member.name: M:LakeShoreCryotronics.FastHall.FastHall.Lock(Ivi.Driver.PrecisionTimeSpan)
member.summary: Attempts to acquire a synchronization lock on this instance of the driver. The calling thread is blocked until either the lock is acquired or maxTime expires. If the lock is not acquired within the interval specified by maxTime, an exception is thrown. This method is useful for gaining exclusive access to the driver instance across a series of methods calls. The user must call the Unlock method on the returned lock to relinquish the lock and allow other threads to access this instance of the driver.
member.param: Specifies the maximum amount of time to wait to acquire the lock.
member.returns: A reference to the acquired lock. Unlock is called on the returned reference.

member.summary: Performs a contact check measurement on contact pairs 5-6, 5-1, 5-2, 5-3, 5-4, and 6-1.
member.param: The starting excitation value. For voltage excitation -10.0 to 10.0 V. For current excitation -100 e3 to 100 e-3 A.
The ending excitation value. For voltage excitation -10.0 to 10.0 V. For current excitation -100 e3 to 100 e-3 A.
For voltage excitation 0 to 10.0 V. For current excitation 0 to 100 e-3 A.
For voltage excitation, specify the current measurement range 0 to 100 e-3 A. For current excitation, specify the voltage measurement range 0 to 10.0 V.
For voltage excitation, specify the current limit 100 e-9 to 100 e-3 A. For current excitation, specify the voltage compliance 1.0 to 10.0 V.
The number of points to measure between the excitation start and end. 0 - 100.
The minimum R² desired, Default = 0.9999.
The time in seconds to wait for the hardware to settle before gathering readings. 0.5 ms to 300 s with a resolution of 0.1 ms. Default = 2 ms
The sampling time in seconds which measurements will be averaged over to get one sample. MINimum = 0.000001 s MAXimum = 1 s DEFault = 1/60 s

member.summary: Resets the measurement to a not run state, canceling any running measurement.

member.name: M:LakeShoreCryotronics.FastHall.FastHall.StartLink(System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Performs a FastHall™ measurement that uses the last run contact check measurement's excitation type, excitation range, compliance limit, blanking time, sampling time, and the largest absolute value of the start and end excitation values along with the last run resistivity measurement's resistivity average and sample thickness if available.
member.param: The field, in units of tesla, that the sample is being subjected to. Used for calculations.
For voltage excitation, specify the current measurement range 0 to 100 e-3 A. For current excitation, specify the voltage measurement range 0 to 10.0 V.
When minimumSnr is omitted or INFinity, the total number of samples to average 1 to 1000. When minimumSnr is specified, the maximum number of samples to average 10 to 1000. Default = 100 .
The desired signal-to-noise ratio of the measurement calculated using average Hall voltage/error of mean 1 to 1000, or INFinity. Default = 30.
The number of voltage compensation samples to average. Only applied for excitation type voltage. Valid range of 1 to 120. Default = 60
Thickness of the sample in meters. Valid Range of 0 to 10e-3 m. Default = 0 m

member.name: M:LakeShoreCryotronics.FastHall.FastHall.All
member.summary: Retrieves ALL the results, including individual samples, of the last run Four wire measurement, serialized as JSON.

member.summary: Resets the measurement to a not run state, canceling any running measurement.

member.summary: Performs a DC Hall measurement for a Hall bar sample.
member.param: The excitation value. For voltage excitation -10.0 to 10.0 V. For current excitation -100 e3 to 100 e-3 A.
For voltage excitation 0 to 10.0 V. For current excitation 0 to 100 e-3 A.
For voltage excitation 0 to 10.0 V. For current excitation 0 to 100 e-3 A.
For voltage excitation, specify the current measurement range 0 to 100 e-3 A. For current excitation, specify the voltage measurement range 0 to 10.0 V.
For voltage excitation, specify the current limit 100 e-9 to 100 e-3 A. For current excitation, specify the voltage compliance 1.0 to 10.0 V.
When minimumSnr is omitted or INFinity (9.9E+37), the total number of samples to average 1 - 1000 When minimumSnr is specified, the maximum number of samples to average 10 - 1000
The field, in units of tesla, that the sample is being subjected to. Used for calculations.
Specifies whether or not to apply reversal field. Default = true

The resistivity of the sample in units of ohm*meters (bulk) of ohms per square (sheet). Used for calculations. Measure this value using the RESistivity SCPI subsystem. Defaults to not a number which will propagate through calculated values. Default = NaN. NOTE: When the resistivity is omitted or NaN, mobility is not calculated.
The time in seconds to wait for the hardware to settle before gathering readings. 0.5 ms to 300 s with a resolution of 0.1 ms. Default = 2 ms, Minimum = 0.5 ms, Maximum = 300 s
Thickness of the sample in meters. Valid Range of 0 to 10e-3 m. Default = 0 m
The desired signal-to-noise ratio of the measured resistance, calculated using measurement average/error of mean 1 - 1000, or INFinity. Default = 30
The sampling time in seconds which measurements will be averaged over to get one sample. MINimum = 0.001 s MAXimum = 1 s

member.summary: Performs a four wire measurement. Excitation is sourced from contact point 1 to contact point 2. Voltage is measured/senses between contact point 3 and contact point 4.
member.param: Excitation +. Valid contact points are: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, or 6. Cannot be the same as Contact Point 2.
Excitation -. Valid contact points are: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, or 6. Cannot be the same as Contact Point 1.
Voltage measure/sense +. Valid contact points are: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, or 6. Cannot be the same as Contact Point 4.
Voltage measure/sense -. Valid contact points are: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, or 6. Cannot be the same as Contact Point 3.
For voltage excitation -10.0 to 10.0 V. For current excitation -100 e3 to 100 e-3 A.
For voltage excitation 0 to 10.0 V. For current excitation 0 to 100 e-3 A.
For voltage excitation, specify the current measurement range 0 to 100 e-3 A. For current excitation, specify the voltage measurement range 0 to 10.0 V.
For voltage excitation 0 to 10.0 V. For current excitation 0 to 100 e-3 A.
For voltage excitation, specify the current limit 100 e-9 to 100 e-3 A. For current excitation, specify the voltage compliance 1.00 to 10.0 V.
The time, in seconds, to wait for hardware to settle before gathering readings. 0.5 ms to 300 s with a resolution of 0.1 ms. Default = 2 ms
When minimumSnr is omitted or INFinity, the total number of samples to average 1 to 1000. When minimumSnr is specified, the maximum number of samples to average 10 to 1000. Default = 100
The desired signal-to-noise ratio of the measured resistance, calculated using measurement average/error of mean 1 - 1000, or INFinity. Default = 30
True = Reverse the excitation to generate the resistance. False = no excitation reversal
The sampling time in seconds which measurements will be averaged over to get one sample. MINimum = 0.001 s MAXimum = 1 s

Voltage measure/sense -. Valid contact points are: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, or 6. Cannot be the same as Contact Point 3.
For voltage excitation -10.0 to 10.0 V. For current excitation -100 e3 to 100 e-3 A.
For voltage excitation, specify the current limit 100 e-9 to 100 e-3 A. For current excitation, specify the voltage compliance 1.00 to 10.0 V.
True = Reverse the excitation to generate the resistance. False = no excitation reversal

member.name: M:LakeShoreCryotronics.FastHall.IFastHallFastH.StartLink(System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Performs a FastHall™ measurement that uses the last run contact check measurement's excitation type, excitation range, compliance limit, blanking time, sampling time, and the largest absolute value of the start and end excitation values along with the last run resistivity measurement's resistivity average and sample thickness if available.
member.param: The field, in units of tesla, that the sample is being subjected to. Used for calculations.
For voltage excitation, specify the current measurement range 0 to 100 e-3 A. For current excitation, specify the voltage measurement range 0 to 10.0 V.
When minimumSnr is omitted or INFinity, the total number of samples to average 1 to 1000. When minimumSnr is specified, the maximum number of samples to average 10 to 1000. Default = 100 .
The desired signal-to-noise ratio of the measurement calculated using average Hall voltage/error of mean 1 to 1000, or INFinity. Default = 30.
The number of voltage compensation samples to average. Only applied for excitation type voltage. Valid range of 1 to 120. Default = 60
Thickness of the sample in meters. Valid Range of 0 to 10e-3 m. Default = 0 m

member.name: M:LakeShoreCryotronics.FastHall.IFastHallFastH.Start(LakeShoreCryotronics.FastHall.ExcitationType,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Performs a FastHall™ measurement
member.param: For voltage excitation -10.0 to 10.0 V. For current excitation -100 e3 to 100 e-3 A.
For voltage excitation 0 to 10.0 V. For current excitation 0 to 100 e-3 A.
For voltage excitation 0 to 10.0 V. For current excitation 0 to 100 e-3 A.
For voltage excitation, specify the current measurement range 0 to 100 e-3 A. For current excitation, specify the voltage measurement range 0 to 10.0 V.
For voltage excitation, specify the current limit 100 e-9 to 100 e-3 A. For current excitation, specify the voltage compliance 1.00 to 10.0 V.
The field, in units of tesla, that the sample is being subjected to. Used for calculations.
When minimumSnr is omitted or INFinity, the total number of samples to average 1 to 1000. When minimumSnr is specified, the maximum number of samples to average 10 to 1000. Default = 100

The resistivity of the sample in units of ohm*meters (bulk) of ohms per square (sheet). Used for calculations. Measure this value using the RESistivity SCPI subsystem. Defaults to not a number which will propagate through calculated values. Default = NaN
The time, in seconds, to wait for hardware to settle before gathering readings. 0.5 ms to 300 s with a resolution of 0.1 ms. Default = 2 ms
The number of voltage compensation samples to average. Only applied forexcitation type voltage. 1 to 120. Default = 60
Thickness of the sample in meters. 0 to 10e-3 m. Default = 0 m
The desired signal-to-noise ratio of the measurement calculated using average Hall voltage/error of mean 1 to 1000, or INFinity. Default = 30
The sampling time in seconds which measurements will be averaged over to get one sample. MINimum = 0.001 s MAXimum = 1 s

member.name: M:LakeShoreCryotronics.FastHall.IFastHallFourWire.Start(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,LakeShoreCryotronics.FastHall.ExcitationType,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: Performs a four wire measurement. Excitation is sourced from contact point 1 to contact point 2. Voltage is measured/senses between contact point 3 and contact point 4.
member.param: Excitation +. Valid contact points are: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, or 6. Cannot be the same as Contact Point 2.
Excitation -. Valid contact points are: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, or 6. Cannot be the same as Contact Point 1.
Voltage measure/sense +. Valid contact points are: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, or 6. Cannot be the same as Contact Point 4.
Voltage measure/sense -. Valid contact points are: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, or 6. Cannot be the same as Contact Point 3.
For voltage excitation -10.0 to 10.0 V. For current excitation -100 e3 to 100 e-3 A.
For voltage excitation 0 to 10.0 V. For current excitation 0 to 100 e-3 A.
For voltage excitation, specify the current measurement range 0 to 100 e-3 A. For current excitation, specify the voltage measurement range 0 to 10.0 V.
For voltage excitation 0 to 10.0 V. For current excitation 0 to 100 e-3 A.
For voltage excitation, specify the current limit 100 e-9 to 100 e-3 A. For current excitation, specify the voltage compliance 1.00 to 10.0 V.
The time, in seconds, to wait for hardware to settle before gathering readings. 0.5 ms to 300 s with a resolution of 0.1 ms. Default = 2 ms
When minimumSnr is omitted or INFinity, the total number of samples to average 1 to 1000. When minimumSnr is specified, the maximum number of samples to average 10 to 1000. Default = 100
The desired signal-to-noise ratio of the measured resistance, calculated using measurement average/error of mean 1 - 1000, or INFinity. Default = 30
True = Reverse the excitation to generate the resistance. False = no excitation reversal
The sampling time in seconds which measurements will be averaged over to get one sample. MINimum = 0.001 s MAXimum = 1 s

member.name: M:LakeShoreCryotronics.FastHall.IFastHallFourWire.Start(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,LakeShoreCryotronics.FastHall.ExcitationType,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean)

member.param: Excitation +. Valid contact points are: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, or 6. Cannot be the same as Contact Point 2.
Excitation -. Valid contact points are: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, or 6. Cannot be the same as Contact Point 1.
Voltage measure/sense +. Valid contact points are: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, or 6. Cannot be the same as Contact Point 4.
Voltage measure/sense -. Valid contact points are: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, or 6. Cannot be the same as Contact Point 3.
For voltage excitation -10.0 to 10.0 V. For current excitation -100 e3 to 100 e-3 A.
For voltage excitation, specify the current limit 100 e-9 to 100 e-3 A. For current excitation, specify the voltage compliance 1.00 to 10.0 V.
True = Reverse the excitation to generate the resistance. False = no excitation reversal

member.name: M:LakeShoreCryotronics.FastHall.IFastHallDCHallHBAR.Start(LakeShoreCryotronics.FastHall.ExcitationType,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Performs a DC Hall measurement for a Hall bar sample.
member.param: The excitation value. For voltage excitation -10.0 to 10.0 V. For current excitation -100 e3 to 100 e-3 A.
For voltage excitation 0 to 10.0 V. For current excitation 0 to 100 e-3 A.
For voltage excitation 0 to 10.0 V. For current excitation 0 to 100 e-3 A.
For voltage excitation, specify the current measurement range 0 to 100 e-3 A. For current excitation, specify the voltage measurement range 0 to 10.0 V.
For voltage excitation, specify the current limit 100 e-9 to 100 e-3 A. For current excitation, specify the voltage compliance 1.0 to 10.0 V.
When minimumSnr is omitted or INFinity (9.9E+37), the total number of samples to average 1 - 1000 When minimumSnr is specified, the maximum number of samples to average 10 - 1000
The field, in units of tesla, that the sample is being subjected to. Used for calculations.
Specifies whether or not to apply reversal field. Default = true

The resistivity of the sample in units of ohm*meters (bulk) of ohms per square (sheet). Used for calculations. Measure this value using the RESistivity SCPI subsystem. Defaults to not a number which will propagate through calculated values. Default = NaN. NOTE: When the resistivity is omitted or NaN, mobility is not calculated.
The time in seconds to wait for the hardware to settle before gathering readings. 0.5 ms to 300 s with a resolution of 0.1 ms. Default = 2 ms, Minimum = 0.5 ms, Maximum = 300 s
Thickness of the sample in meters. Valid Range of 0 to 10e-3 m. Default = 0 m
The desired signal-to-noise ratio of the measured resistance, calculated using measurement average/error of mean 1 - 1000, or INFinity. Default = 30
The sampling time in seconds which measurements will be averaged over to get one sample. MINimum = 0.001 s MAXimum = 1 s

The field, in units of tesla, that the sample is being subjected to. Used for calculations.
Specifies whether or not to apply reversal field. Default = true

member.summary: Calculates the optimal blanking time for a contact check on this sample.
member.param: Excitation +. Valid contact points are: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, or 6. Cannot be the same as Contact Point 2.
Excitation -. Valid contact points are: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, or 6. Cannot be the same as Contact Point 1.
Voltage measure/sense +. Valid contact points are: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, or 6. Cannot be the same as Contact Point 4.
Voltage measure/sense -. Valid contact points are: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, or 6. Cannot be the same as Contact Point 3.
